entry.name: slider
entry.title: Slider Widget
entry.desc: Drag a handle to select a numeric value.

longdesc.p: The jQuery UI Slider plugin makes selected elements into sliders. There are various options such as multiple handles and ranges. The handle can be moved with the mouse or the arrow keys.

The slider widget will create handle elements with the class ui-slider-handle on initialization. You can specify custom handle elements by creating and appending the elements and adding the ui-slider-handle class before initialization. It will only create the number of handles needed to match the length of value/values. For example, if you specify values: [ 1, 5, 18 ] and create one custom handle, the plugin will create the other two.

ul.li:
ui-slider: The track of the slider control. This element will additionally have a class name of ui-slider-horizontal or ui-slider-vertical depending on the orientation option of the slider.
ui-slider-handle: One of the slider handles.
ui-slider-range: The selected range used when the range option is set. This element can additionally have a class of ui-slider-range-min or ui-slider-range-max if the range option is set to "min" or "max" respectively.

option.name: animate
option.desc: Whether to slide the handle smoothly when the user clicks on the slider track. Also accepts any valid animation duration.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: When set to true, the handle will animate with the default duration.

type.name: String
type.desc: The name of a speed, such as "fast" or "slow".

type.name: Number
type.desc: The duration of the animation, in milliseconds.

option.name: max
option.desc: The maximum value of the slider.

option.name: min
option.desc: The minimum value of the slider.

option.name: orientation
option.desc: Determines whether the slider handles move horizontally (min on left, max on right) or vertically (min on bottom, max on top). Possible values: "horizontal", "vertical".

option.name: range
option.desc: Whether the slider represents a range.

type.name: Boolean
type.desc: If set to true, the slider will detect if you have two handles and create a styleable range element between these two.

type.name: String
type.desc: Either "min" or "max". A min range goes from the slider min to one handle. A max range goes from one handle to the slider max.

option.name: step
option.desc: Determines the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between the min and max. The full specified value range of the slider (max - min) should be evenly divisible by the step.

option.name: value
option.desc: Determines the value of the slider, if there's only one handle. If there is more than one handle, determines the value of the first handle.

option.name: values
option.desc: This option can be used to specify multiple handles. If the range option is set to true, the length of values should be 2.

event.name: start
event.desc: Triggered when the user starts sliding.

property.name: handle
property.desc: The HTML element representing the handle being moved.

property.name: handleIndex
property.desc: The numeric index of the handle being moved.

property.name: value
property.desc: The current value of the slider.

event.name: slide
event.desc: Triggered on every mouse move during slide. The value provided in the event as ui.value represents the value that the handle will have as a result of the current movement. Canceling the event will prevent the handle from moving and the handle will continue to have its previous value.

property.name: handle
property.desc: The HTML element representing the handle being moved.

property.name: handleIndex
property.desc: The numeric index of the handle being moved.

property.name: value
property.desc: The value that the handle will move to if the event is not canceled.

property.name: values
property.desc: An array of the current values of a multi-handled slider.

event.name: change
event.desc: Triggered after the user slides a handle, if the value has changed; or if the value is changed programmatically via the value method.

property.name: handle
property.desc: The HTML element representing the handle that was changed.

property.name: handleIndex
property.desc: The numeric index of the handle that was moved.

property.name: value
property.desc: The current value of the slider.

event.name: stop
event.desc: Triggered after the user slides a handle.

property.name: handle
property.desc: The HTML element representing the handle that was moved.

property.name: handleIndex
property.desc: The numeric index of the handle that was moved.

property.name: value
property.desc: The current value of the slider.

method.name: value
method.desc: Get or set the value of the slider.

signature.desc: Get the value of the slider.
Set the value of the slider.

method.name: values
method.desc: Get or set the handle value(s).

signature.desc: Get the value for all handles.
Get the value for the specified handle.

argument.name: index
argument.desc: The zero-based index of the handle.

signature.desc: Set the value for the specified handle.

argument.name: index
argument.desc: The zero-based index of the handle.

signature.desc: Set the value for all handles.
